Class User

java.lang.Object
com.mycompany.agenziadiviaggi.User
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class User extends Object implements Serializable
Author:
luca gabossi this class is a representation of a user and can create an object of type User.

    • travelPlanning

      public void travelPlanning​(String destination, int id, int startDayOfMonths, int startValueOfMonth, int startYear, int endDayOfMonths, int endValueOfMonth, int endYear) throws MaximumReached
      this method allows you to plan a trip (invoking the Travel class constructor) by entering a destination, an id (of the trip), a travel start day, a travel start month, a travel start year, a travel end day, a month end of the trip, one year of end of the trip. in addition to this it allows to make the payment of the trip if the wallet has the possibility, in case of overrun of the array (traveluser) the method will raise an exception called MaximumReached which will show an error output with the maximum that has been overrun.
      Parameters:
      destination - :(String)is the travel destination.
      id - :(int)is an entire identification code, used to make a trip unique.
      startDayOfMonths - :(int) it is the day of departure of a trip.
      startValueOfMonth - :(int) is the month of departure of the trip.
      startYear - :(int) it is the year of departure of the trip.
      endDayOfMonths - :(int) is the end day of a trip.
      endValueOfMonth - :int) is the month of end of the trip.
      endYear - :(int) it is the year of end of the trip.
      Throws:
      MaximumReached - :represents a customized version of the "ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException" exception, and allows you to make the overflow limit visible.

    • cancelATravel

      public int cancelATravel​(int idTravel) throws ItemNotFound, travelsNotFound
      this method deletes a trip from the travel array by passing it an id (of the trip) as input, obviously if it does not find it it raises an exception called ItemNotFound which sends an error message / warning to the user, if there are none voyages present in the user's travel array an exception named travelsNotFound is raised and shows an error.
      Parameters:
      idTravel - : is the id of the trip you want to cancel.
      Returns:
      (int) it always returns 0 if the operation is successful but in reality it is useless I used it only to exit the for so.
      Throws:
      ItemNotFound - :it is a personal exception and is used for when a certain "item" is not found, for example if the travel id is never found it is raised by generating a warning / error for the user telling him that the travel id is not found.
      travelsNotFound - :it is a personal exception and is for when there are no trips entered in the travel array.

    • showTravelsSortedByEntry

      public String showTravelsSortedByEntry() throws NullPointer, travelsNotFound
      Returns:
      (String) this method shows all the user's journeys sorted by entry, and returns them as a string.
      Throws:
      NullPointer - : this exception occurs if you try to invoke a toString on the null trip.
      travelsNotFound - : this exception occurs if the user has no travel.

    • showTravelsSortedByDeparture

      public String showTravelsSortedByDeparture() throws NullPointer, travelsNotFound
      Returns:
      (String) this method shows all the user's trips sorted by departure and returns them as a string.
      Throws:
      NullPointer - : this exception occurs if you try to invoke a toString on the null trip.
      travelsNotFound - : this exception occurs if the user has no travel.

    • postponeTravel

      public int postponeTravel​(int idTravel, int startDayOfMonths, int startValueOfMonth, int startYear, int endDayOfMonths, int endValueOfMonth, int endYear) throws ItemNotFound, travelsNotFound
      this method simply allows you to change the departure and end date of a trip, passing it as inpuit the id of the trip, and the day, month, year of start and end, ATTENTION: this method will not do any kind of check on the data input so it is preferable to check before using it.
      Parameters:
      idTravel - : is the identification code of the trip whose date you want to change.
      startDayOfMonths - : it is the day of departure of the trip.
      startValueOfMonth - :is the month of departure of the trip.
      startYear - :is the year of departure of the trip.
      endDayOfMonths - : it is the day of the end of the journey.
      endValueOfMonth - : is the month of the end of the trip
      endYear - : it is the year of the end of the journey.
      Returns:
      (int) it can be neglected, because it only serves to make the method terminate quickly without too many problems, however it always returns a 0 if it is okay otherwise it raises the ItemNotFound exception.
      Throws:
      ItemNotFound - : this exception occurs when you try to search for an item and it is not found.
      travelsNotFound - : this exception occurs if the user has no travel.

    • addCredit

      public void addCredit​(float credit)
      this method will add to the wallet a share of the money entered by the user.
      Parameters:
      credit - : (flaot)represents how much money the user wants to put into the wallet.

    • showDestinations

      public String showDestinations()
      Returns:
      (String)this method shows all the user's destinations without duplicates, obviously it only shows the names in a simple list without too much information, for example if user A has two trips both to france the method will return a string with france and not france france ,basically it puts the user's destinations in a string once.
